org.apache.uima.wikipedia.ae.parser
Class MWLanguage

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.mylyn.wikitext.core.parser.markup.MarkupLanguage
      org.eclipse.mylyn.wikitext.core.parser.markup.AbstractMarkupLanguage
          org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.wikitext.mediawiki.core.AbstractMediaWikiLanguage
              org.eclipse.mylyn.wikitext.mediawiki.core.MediaWikiLanguage
                  org.apache.uima.wikipedia.ae.parser.MWLanguage
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public class MWLanguage
extends MediaWikiLanguage

This class subclasses the default MediaWiki language implementation provided by MyLyn WikiText in order to finely tune the behaviour for our application.

Most of the blocks constituting the MediaWiki language have been rewritten and replaced by new ones. In particular, our blocks do not take care of the CSS attributes (it gets stripped) as our target output is raw text.

We also enabled the use of a customized template processor (the RegEx have been tuned) in order to hopefully improve performance and also accept a wider set of valid tokens as templates.

Author:
Maxime Bury <Maxime.bury@gmail.com>

Method Detail

addMacro

public void addMacro(String name,
                     String replacement)
Add a new macro (template) to the language.

There is several kinds of macro. See here for more details on the syntaxe.

What you need to know here, is that the identifier is the lower case version of the template name. It may be composed of several words, and contain any character except '}' and '|'. The replacement text can be anything of your liking. If you want to take in account parameters, {{{1}}} will be replaced by the first parameter value. Alternatively, if the parameters are named, you can use {{{name}}}.

For more intelligent processing of the macros, one can improve the template resolver.

Parameters:
name - the macro identifier
replacement - the text replacement for the macro

processContent

public void processContent(MarkupParser parser,
                           String markupContent,
                           boolean asDocument)
If macros are enabled, pre process the markup to make the replacements. Unknown macros will be stripped. Only then the markup is processed. Events are sent to the document builder until the end of the document is reached.

Overrides:
processContent in class org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.wikitext.mediawiki.core.AbstractMediaWikiLanguage
